item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle update adds an outfit suitable to eat chilled monkey brains in
item.content:encoded:
The team at MachineGames has issued a new update for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle.

Along with bug fixes such as sorting incorrect manual entries and the correcting the VO balance on some scenes to make the speech more audible, this update has also added a new outfit for Indy.

This one is the Pankot Palace outfit, so yes, the outfit Indy wore in Temple of Doom when he was served chilled monkey brains. That scene still makes me shiver. The outfit pops Indiana Jones into his round spectacles and bowtie. You can see how it looks in-game via the image further below.

As well as today's new outfit, MachineGames has also promised another new outfit still to come down the line. I wonder which one they will choose?

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

You can check out the full details for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's latest update below:

New Features

Pankot Palace outfit is now available

We've added a new outfit for Indy for all players, based on the suit he wore to dinner at Pankot Palace in Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom.

  • To switch to the new outfit, visit the 'Outfit' tab in the Options menu and select the 'Pankot Palace' outfit. Any other custom outfits you have from Pre-Order or Premium upgrades are also in this tab.
  • Indy will wear this outfit whenever he isn't wearing a disguise, or if the level requires a special outfit such as in Marshall College or in Nepal
  • There's still another new outfit to come in a future update… so stay tuned

Bug fixes and game updates

Main Game

  • Fixed the VO balance on some scenes to make the speech more audible
  • Fixed an issue where the game’s manual entries were incorrect about alternative outfits and whips
  • Fixed an issue with power-saving mode on Xbox Series X/S that could cause it to activate in the middle of some videos

The Order of Giants DLC

  • Fixed an issue where the Fieldwork name for 'A Mystery Begins' may not appear correctly in your Journal if you had already progressed beyond the Vatican when first purchasing the DLC

Earlier this year, MachineGames added New Game+ to Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, which allows players to carry over Adventure Books and unspent Adventure Points, currency, and Medicine Bottles from a previous playthrough.

item.title: Ubisoft just can't keep its Assassin's Creed Black Flag remake a secret, and it's now been spotted again ahead of The Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft's long-rumoured Black Flag remake is seemingly even closer to reality after a listing for Assassin's Creed Black Flag Resynced was spotted on the Pan European Game Information (PEGI) ratings board website.

Rumours of a Black Flag remake first surfaced back in 2023, when it was reported a new version of the celebrated 2013 open-world pirate game was in development at Ubisoft Singapore, which was still embroiled in Skull and Bones' protracted development at the time. The report claimed the remake was "in its earliest stages" and "at least a few years" away from release.

Four years later, the project still hasn't been officially announced (with Ubisoft perhaps keen to avoid a premature reveal and another Sands of Time-style embarrassment), but that hasn't stopped the evidence of its existence from piling up. Earlier this year, for instance, actor Matt Ryan - who played Black Flag protagonist Edward Kenway - hinted at the remake's seemingly imminent arrival, only for Ubisoft to threaten him with legal action.

Now, however, something called Assassin's Creed Black Flag Resynced has appeared (albeit seemingly briefly) on the PEGI website, rated 18 for violence, bad language, and in-game purchases. So is Resynced the long-rumoured Black Flag remake? Obviously, nothing is certain until it's official, but at this point - and with that name - it's harder to believe it isn't. And given Ubisoft recently confirmed it still had an "unannounced title" to launch before 31st March next year, it's probably out very soon.

Which just leaves the small matter of an official announcement, and with Geoff Keighley's The Game Awards primed and ready to launch its annual assault of announcements, adverts, and Kojimas upon us this week, I know where I'll be pointing my eyes for likely Black Flag remake reveals.

Related topics
